plugins.name: FigmaScript
plugins.description:
Javascript code editor with a familiar interface and a simple file system that allows you to save your scripts


Write your own or open an existing script and go to the menu Actions -> Run Script to run it


Select any property or method and go to the Actions -> Help menu. A window will open with a brief description and a button to go to the documentation page.


Add saved files using import:

import "file1.js"
import "file2.js"


When exporting a file, all files imported into it are collected in one script


Added documentAccess: "dynamic-page" to the manifest. See API changes at https://www.figma.com/plugin-docs/migrating-to-dynamic-loading/

plugins.name: Color Extractly 🎨 | Extract Colors from Any Text or Code
plugins.description:
Your go-to sorcery for pulling colors out of any text or code!

Simply paste any code or text—from a snippet to full website code—and watch as our plugin effortlessly extracts vibrant color values. No perfection needed, just paste and let the magic unfold! 🪄✨

+ Generates and aligns Design Systems in seconds!


✨ Key Features

  1. ✅ Instant Color Extraction: Directly pull color values from text and code.
  2. 🔖 Auto-Organize, Group & Name: Streamline your workflow with automatic color sorting and naming for better management.
  3. 📝 Text-to-Color Variables & Styles: Easily create and manage color variables & styles from textual input, ready for Figma.
  4. 🚀 Effortless Integration: Seamlessly import colors into Figma, allowing immediate application to your designs.
  5. 🔄 Clean & Tidy UI: Maintain a clutter-free color palette by eliminating redundant colors automatically.
  6. ✏️ Distill Typo to Text Styles
  7. 🔤 Add Matching Text Style(s) to Element(s)
  8. 🔢 Distill Number Attributes to Variables
  9. 🔄 Replace Number Attributes with Variables
  10. 🌈 Replace Color(s) with Variables/Styles
  11. 💫 Reset All Instance Overrides (except images & text)
  12. 🎭 Generate Component Sets from Selections
  13. ✂️ Auto Image Crop for transparent and similar-colored edges
  14. ---
  15. 💥 Destroy all variables and styles
  16. 💀 Destroy all Instances


🎨 Color Management

  1. Extract colors from code snippets, text, and CSS
  2. Extract colors from Figma selection (fills, strokes, text)
  3. Replace colors with matching local or library styles
  4. Auto-detect and preserve variable names from CSS/SCSS/LESS
  5. Smart color matching with configurable threshold
  6. Preserve opacity and color relationships
  7. Smart naming from layer structure and code
  8. User-controlled naming through layer organization
  9. Preserves design system hierarchies
  10. Automatic semantic color naming


🔄 Variable & Style Management

  1. Convert text layers to reusable text styles
  2. ↳ Use -- prefix in layer names for custom style naming
  3. ↳ Supports nested style groups via layer names
  4. ↳ Example: --headline-mobile-h2 → "Headline/mobile/h2"
  5. Create variables from numeric properties (spacing, sizes)
  6. Replace numbers with matching local or library variables
  7. Smart matching for similar values and properties
  8. Bulk apply styles across selected elements
  9. Naming based on layer and frame structure
  10. Smart detection of design patterns
  11. Preserves component naming hierarchies
  12. Context-aware variable naming


🧩 Component Tools

  1. Convert selections to components or component sets
  2. Replace elements with matching components
  3. Smart component organization and property detection
  4. Cross-library component replacement support


🔄 Instance Management

  1. Selectively reset instance overrides
  2. Reset colors, typography, effects, or layout
  3. Preserve specific overrides while resetting others
  4. Batch process multiple instances


🧹 Cleanup & Organization

  1. Remove redundant colors automatically
  2. Group similar colors and properties
  3. Auto-generate meaningful variable names
  4. Maintain clean, organized style libraries


💣 Cleanup & Reset Tools

  1. Remove styles and variables from selected elements
  2. Detach instances while preserving appearance
  3. Clean up unused styles and properties
  4. Remove hidden layers automatically
  5. Smart component restoration capabilities
  6. Batch processing for multiple elements


🖼️ Image Tools

  1. Batch process image fills across multiple elements instantly
  2. Trim transparent and solid-colored edges from selected images
  3. Set image fills to Fit for clean scaling inside containers
  4. Set image fills to Fill for edge-to-edge visual coverage
  5. Tile image fills for repeating patterns and textures


💡 Smart Features

  1. Automatic color format detection (HEX, RGB, HSL)
  2. Smart variable naming based on context
  3. Configurable matching thresholds
  4. Cross-library style and variable support
  5. Bulk processing capabilities


🛠️ User Experience

  1. Clean, intuitive interface
  2. Quick filters and search functionality
  3. Real-time preview of changes
  4. Undo/redo support
  5. Detailed tooltips and documentation

accepted.name: Dave
accepted.description: Snatching moments from a busy life, I craft tools to simplify designers' work... Writing bios, however, is not my forte. Also love my client work at uxact.ly

plugins.name: Duck Plugin- Auto generate content
plugins.description:
To Use the Plugin:


  1. Run the Duck plugin.
  2. Select the text layers.
  3. Choose the generator for what you want.
  4. Click on Apply, and Tada!!!

Generate Text:

  1. Select Language
  2. You can generate a Name, Full Name, or Username in the "User" tab.
  3. Generate a Random Address in Vietnam or US in the "Location" tab.


Generate Number:

  1. Select the range of your number.
  2. Choose between an integer or decimal number.
  3. Sort the results.
  4. Include negative numbers if desired.


Generate Time:

  1. Select the range for your time.
  2. Customize your result using the "Custom format" field.
  3. Review your result.


Feedback

plugins.name: Pomodoro
plugins.description:
The Pomodoro Technique is a time management method developed by Francesco Cirillo in the late 1980s. It uses a kitchen timer to break work into intervals, typically 25 minutes in length, separated by short breaks. Each interval is known as a pomodoro, from the Italian word for tomato, after the tomato-shaped kitchen timer Cirillo used as a university student


Recommended usage:


  1. Decide on the task to be done.
  2. Set the pomodoro timer (typically for 25 minutes).
  3. Work on the task.
  4. End work when the timer rings and take a short break (typically 5–10 minutes).
  5. If you have finished fewer than three pomodoros, go back to Step 2 and repeat until you go through all three pomodoros.
  6. After three pomodoros are done, take the fourth pomodoro and then take a long break (typically 20 to 30 minutes). Once the long break is finished, return to step 2.

accepted.name: Abhishek Kalia
accepted.description: Designer of interfaces, developer of frontends and maintainer of design systems.

plugins.tagline: A simple Pomodoro (25 minute) timer. Stay focused and on top of your work!

plugins.name: Optimize.svg
plugins.description:
Copy your layers/frames into optimized svg code. Toggle on/off settings to dial in your optimization depending on your use case.


While in Dev Mode and the Inspect Panel is active: Select your frame/layer to generate optimized svg code for you to copy and paste inline within your code.


Optimize.svg leverages the power of svgo.js and its extensive plugin options. We have enabled a few by default to help optimize your code out of the box along with providing toggle options for others.


Dev Settings that can be toggled on/off:

  • Width of Viewbox
  • Use Layer Names - Use your layers/frames names as IDs or Classes by toggling this option
  • Remove Doctype
  • Remove XMLNS
  • Merge Paths
  • Inline Styles
  • Merge Style
  • Minify Styles
  • Convert Ellipse to Circle
  • Convert Shape to Path


Set by Default


cleanupAttrs
cleanupEnableBackground
cleanupNumericValues
collapseGroups
convertColors
convertPathData
convertTransform
moveElemsAttrsToGroup
moveGroupAttrsToElems
removeComments
removeDesc
removeEmptyAttrs
removeEmptyContainers
removeEmptyText
removeHiddenElems
removeMetadata
removeNonInheritableGroupAttrs
removeTitle
removeUnknownsAndDefaults
removeUnusedNS
removeUselessDefs
removeUselessStrokeAndFill
removeXMLProcInst
sortAttrs
sortDefsChildren

plugins.name: Contrast Description
plugins.description:
Quickly add WCAG contrast info to your color styles and variables for easy reference! No need to break your design flow to check accessibility!


This helps everyone working in the file or design library know which color pairs are safe to use by providing contextual information directly in the Figma UI.


  1. Easy to setup Just run once! Setup is as easy as running the plugin and selecting which colors you are using for text. The plugin will determine the contrast ratio for each color you select against every other color style in the file.
  2. Easy to use No need to open the plugin again, contrast info is now visible in the Figma UI! Hover over the swatches of your color styles to see the contrast ratio for that color.
  3. Flexible You can calculate the contrast ratio for as many colors as you want!


Limitations

This only works with solid fill colors. No gradients or images. For variables, this works with color variables in one collection and one color mode.


Support & Bug Reporting

Contribute to this plugin on GitHub

plugins.name: Character counter
plugins.description:
Character Counter for Figma

Description:

The Character Counter is an essential tool for designers and copywriters collaborating in Figma. It allows you to quickly know how many characters and lines a text block contains, facilitating communication and ensuring texts fit perfectly into designs.


🚀 How to Use:

  1. Selection: Start by selecting a text block in Figma that you wish to analyze.
  2. Activate the Plugin: Open the "Character Counter" plugin in Figma.
  3. View: As soon as the plugin is opened, it will automatically display the character and line count of the selected text block.
  4. Document: If you wish to create a result frame on your design, click the "To document" button. This will generate a frame next to your text with the character and line count.
  5. Multiple Selections: You can select multiple text blocks and click "To document" to generate result frames for each of them.


📌 Tips:

Use this plugin to ensure copywriters know the exact space they have to work with.

Ideal for teams wanting to maintain consistency and accuracy in their designs.
plugins.tagline: Measure Your Message: Instant Character & Line Counts in Figma!

plugins.name: Semantic Color Sync
plugins.description:
It’s easy for developers and designers to know exactly what color to use when your colors have semantic names. Primary600? That name doesn't mean much. PrimaryButtonLabel? That's clear as can be.

This plugin makes it simple to maintain a collection of semantically named colors that derive their color from your base palette. Not only does this allow you to increase clarity of usage, it also lays the foundation necessary for theming within your apps. 

For more details on why you should implement your colors this way, read this blog post:
https://dev.to/ynab/a-semantic-color-system-the-theory-hk7

Using Semantic Color Sync is simple. First, create your base palette. For each base palette color, add a consistent prefix, such as “.palette/”

Next, create a series of semantically named colors. In the description for each semantically named color, add the base palette color it derives from (including the prefix). For example: “.palette/primary600”

Next, when you decide to change your primary hue from blue to bright pink (good choice, btw), the Semantic Color Sync plugin will automatically search through every semantically named color and update their color to match the updates made in your base palette. 

No need to update things by hand... Ugh. Just tweak your base palette and run this plugin to propagate the changes throughout all of your semantically named colors!

And again, if you’re curious why this is useful, this blog post has it all laid out: 
https://dev.to/ynab/a-semantic-color-system-the-theory-hk7

accepted.name: YNAB Design Team
accepted.description: The budgeting app that changes lives.

plugins.name: Sprout UI - FREE Figma Web UI Kit Component Library
plugins.description:
Welcome to the Sprout Plugin!

We’re thrilled to introduce the Sprout Plugin—a powerful Figma component library that merges the best of SproutUi, Blog Sprout, Shop Sprout, Wire Sprout, and more. This plugin is designed to revolutionize how you design, offering a one-stop solution for building stunning, scalable user interfaces. Whether you're crafting websites, eCommerce stores, blogs, or wireframes, this plugin brings together everything you need in one place.


What’s Inside?

plugins.name: Bunch description change
plugins.description:
Change multiple descriptions of your components, styles or variables at once! Even works with Documentation Links!


Based on the Figma rename-tool (CMD + R), it's powerful and simple to use. Just select a few components and open the plugin.


You can find & replace (even with Regular Expressions if you want), or just change every description. Also supports importing the recently used values, using incrementing (or decrementing) numbers, the current description and the layer name.


This plugin offers a nice preview to see what your descriptions will look like before changing it.


For Components

Change multiple descriptions of your selected components at once!

You can also switch to document-wide mode to change all components in the whole document. But be careful, that's very powerful! 😄


For Styles

Change the description of text, color, effect and grid styles. Just switch to the "Styles" tab!


New: For Variables

You can now also change the description of all of your variables across all collections. Just switch to the new "Variables" tab!



—


Feature requests? 😊 Questions?

Just hit me on X (@madebyfabian), via mail (hello@madebyfabian.com) or via an Issue on GitHub.


—


Made with ❤️ by Fabian B. in Nuremberg, Germany. Want to support me? Would appreciate that very much! http://buymeacoff.ee/madebyfabian

plugins.name: Rapid Copywriting
plugins.description:
Easily add some really good copywriting to your design, rapidly.


Access 1000+ fine-tuned copywriting options for UI and landing pages generated by AI. The texts are stored locally for easy and fast access, with no subscription required. Say goodbye to boring copywriting in your designs.


Still can't move on from lorem ipsum? We've got you covered with lorem included.


What's included:


  • 1000+ copy ideas
  • Quickly swap existing text in your selection with one click
  • Instant search results based on keywords
  • Organized website and UI copy categories
  • Variants of formal and casual tones to choose from


How to use:


Simply click to swap the ready-made copywriting with your selected text layer.


Use the search filter to find the desired tone, such as "formal" or "casual".


Please note: Lists are randomized to offer different options every time you use the plugin or search in categories.


What not to expect from the plugin:


  • Waiting for AI to generate the texts for you.
  • Spending time to create prompts to get some texts.


These copywritings were handpicked so you don't have to spend time prompting texts from AI.
plugins.tagline: Find the right words fast. Instant keyword results, instant ideas, instant swap.

plugins.name: Neumorphism Shadow Generator
plugins.description:
Easy-to-use plugin for creating beautiful neumorphic shadow effects.


Customize shadows, auto-gradient generator to match color and light, modify the shape to see how it behaves in different border radius and sizes to achieve sleek, modern designs with a few clicks.


  1. Generate the shadow
  2. Insert the primitive shape to Figma
  3. Copy the styles and paste them onto your ui element (Text, Frame, Rectangle, etc)
  4. The inserted element serves as documentation when saving the generated shadow as a style


Features:

  1. Customizable Light Source: Adjust the direction of the light source to create the perfect shadow effect.
  2. Shadow Intensity Control: Fine-tune the depth and softness of shadows to enhance the neumorphic look.
  3. Gradient or Solid Backgrounds: Easily switch between gradient or solid color backgrounds to match your design.
  4. Shape Customization: Choose from flat, concave, convex, or pressed styles for a variety of neumorphic effects.
  5. Corner Radius Control: Modify the corner radius to achieve soft, rounded edges or sharp corners.
  6. Dynamic Box Shadows: Generate and customize shadows for elements, including support for inner shadows.
  7. Real-time Updates: Automatically apply changes to your selected design element in real time.
  8. Seamless Figma Integration: Works directly within Figma with a user-friendly interface.

plugins.name: Mini Canvas
plugins.description:
Mini Canvas is an additional canvas to display your selected layer at 100% zoom. It’s primarily useful when designing icons so you don’t need to constantly zoom in and out. Additionally, you can “pin” a layer which becomes useful when pinning components. For example, you might pin a tab bar component, with several icon components inside. When making changes to any of the icon components, you’ll always see updates for the tab bar, making it easier to ensure all the icons feel balanced next to one another.






Enjoy!




Notes:

- Updates to the canvas are only generated everytime your selection changes. If you have a pinned layer, you’ll need to deselect all layers to generate a new update.

plugins.name: Cloner Pro
plugins.description:
How to use

  • Open the plugin.
  • Select one or more objects you want to clone.
  • Review the clone settings
  • Click on "Generate clones" to generate clones.

Capabilities

  • Clone single/multiple objects in a 2-dimensional array and control spacing and number on each axis.
  • Clone mode can be iterative or random
  • Affect scale, position, rotation and color using optionally using either a luma map or random value.
  • Control the magnitude of the effect on scale and position independently on x and y axis.
  • Generate seedable random Perlin noise for use as luma map
  • Use your own image as luma map
  • The generated clones will work with smart animate as the layer names are kept consistent

Limitations

  • Won't work will all types of Figma objects.
  • You will need to manually take care of aspect ratios by controlling clone array parameters.
  • Using large numbers of clones can lead to performance issues. It's best to stay below 100x100, that is below 10,000 objects at a time.
  • In-plugin gradient generation is not supported yet. You can use image upload as a work around.
  • The plugin won't remember the last used values once it is closed.
  • The plugin can't update or edit clones once generated. You must generate new ones every time.


Credits

  • Color gradient tool
  • Seedrandom.js
plugins.tagline: Clone objects in organic patterns with random noise

plugins.name: 100 Race
plugins.description:
Multiplayer platforming in Figma with friends! 🕹


Play and create race courses to compete with your friends! Example courses


To create a game, select a world and run this Plugin.


To join a game, run the Plugin while another game is running. The Plugin will automatically find and join a game if one exists in the same Figma file.


Create custom courses

To create custom courses, create a Frame and place rectangles inside! Optionally place something that looks like a goal post somewhere. Players will spawn at the bottom-left of the frame. Collision detection is done only between rectangles, so only non-rotated rectangles are supported and every other layer is ignored. Also overlapping rectangles can cause weirdnesses right now so try to have them not overlap if possible. You can name a layer "bg" to have collision detection ignore it (for custom art). When you're done, select your Frame and run this Plugin to race!


How it works

This is a simple plugin that takes in user input and does some simple platforming calculations to move a node around. The viewport then follows that node. The magic lies in Figma's multiplayer, which lets up to 100 users run this plugin simultaneously to edit nodes on the same page. There is no countdown timer to start the race, no finish line detection, no concept of lives or death.

plugins.name: Geogebra For Figma
plugins.description:
Create function graphs easily by entering formulas into a simple form.


Key Features


  1. Graph Exporting: Enter formulas and quickly export function graphs.
  2. Graph Editing: Select an exported graph, then reopen the plugin or press the EditGraph button in the right panel to modify it.
  3. Action Bar: Adjust graph size and reset the view to the origin as needed.
  4. Graph Insertion: Directly export graphs into selected Frames or Groups.


This plugin leverages the GeoGebra API, enabling intuitive graph creation and editing within Figma. For more detailed guidance, please refer to the GeoGebra Documentation.


Note: Before exporting, the app automatically switches to full-screen mode for an accurate preview. For best results, review the graph in full-screen mode before export.



Contribute and Connect


Version management for this plugin is now on GitHub, allowing you to view updates and contribute here: GeoGebra for Figma on GitHub. We welcome contributions, suggestions, and feedback from the community.

Create function graphs easily by entering formulas into a simple form.


Key Features


  1. Graph Exporting: Enter formulas and quickly export function graphs.
  2. Graph Editing: Select an exported graph, then reopen the plugin or press the EditGraph button in the right panel to modify it.
  3. Action Bar: Adjust graph size and reset the view to the origin as needed.

This plugin leverages the GeoGebra API, enabling intuitive graph creation and editing within Figma. For more detailed guidance, please refer to the GeoGebra Documentation.


Note: Before exporting, the app automatically switches to full-screen mode for an accurate preview. For best results, review the graph in full-screen mode before export.

plugins.name: Design Tokenizer
plugins.description:
Design Tokenizer parses style information and generates design tokens in JSON format. The JSON file is suitable for consumption by a build system framework like style-dictionary. 

A basic design libarary is available for you to study, as well as an example project that demonstrates end-to-end integration of design tokens. Just click the help link!
_______________________________________________________________________

How the plugin works:
Figma stores your text, color, effect, and layout styles as internal style objects. Design Tokenizer will parse everything it can from these objects.

Additioally, Design Tokenizer can generate tokens for your margin and padding spacers, radii, and border widths as long as you follow certain conventions:

Frame
- Create a frame and name it “Sizes.”
- Created rectangles for each custom style.

Spacer Rectangles
- Name spacers “spacer/name”. 
- The width and height values are tokenized. 

Corner Radius Rectangles
- Name radii “corner-radius/name”.
- The corner radius value is tokenized. 

Border Width Rectangles
- Name border widths “border/name”.
- The stroke width value is tokenized.
_______________________________________________________________________

Limitations:
- Image-based color styles are not supported.

accepted.name: Lee Brenner
accepted.description: principal designer @ Funsize

plugins.name: Name Layers
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically renames layers based on predefined naming conventions.

Select frames and rectangles, then run the plugin from the menu.


Menu:

  1. Set Names: Rename frame and rectangle layers based on the naming conventions (excluding those with unique names).
  2. Reset Names: Reset renamed frames and rectangles to default names without numbers (excluding those with unique names).
  3. Reset All Frames and Rectangles: Reset all frames and rectangles to default names without numbers.
  4. Add Suffix: Add size or date suffixes to the names of selected frame layers.
  5. Remove Suffix: Remove suffixes from the names of selected frame layers.
  6. Override Naming with Local Variables: Replace naming labels with local variables.


Naming Conventions:

You can change the value of a variable to any name.

To skip renaming, comment out the value using /* */ or delete the variable.


Layout

  1. root: 'wrapper' // A frame located under a page or section.
  2. container: 'container' // A frame with a max-width that is centered.
  3. grid: 'grid' // A frame with a horizontal layout and children of the same width.
  4. cell: 'cell' // Frames of the same width within a horizontal layout.
  5. row: 'row' // A frame within a horizontal layout that is also horizontal.
  6. col: 'col' // A frame within a horizontal layout that is also vertical.
  7. center: 'center' // A frame that aligns items to the center.
  8. verticalLayout: 'stack' // A frame with a vertical layout.
  9. horizontalLayout: 'flex' // A frame with a horizontal layout.
  10. wrap: 'wrap' // A frame with a horizontal layout and wrapping.
  11. space: 'space' // An empty frame.
  12. image: 'image' // A rectangle filled with an image.
  13. line: 'line' // A frame and rectangle determined by aspect ratio.
  14. minWidth: 'min' // A frame with a min-width.
  15. maxWidth: 'max' // A frame with a max-width.


Suffix

  1. suffix: '_{width}x{height}_{yy}{mm}{dd}' // The parts enclosed in curly braces are variables (width, height, year, month, and day). You can customize the format. For example:
  2. '-w{width}px-h{height}px' => LayerName-w375px-h640px
  3. '{yyyy}-{mm}-{dd}' => LayerName 2024-08-31
plugins.tagline: Rename Frames Automatically

plugins.name: Repeat As List
plugins.description:
Running this command:

  1. Creates a component from your current selection
  2. Wraps that component in an Auto Layout frame with another instance
  3. Mash ⌘D to Duplicate the instance as many times as needed
  4. Editing the first item in the list will keep the rest in sync

Works like Adobe XDs repeat grid (but only in a vertical stack). This use case is very common during rapid ideation or digital white boarding.


Code @ github.com/arniebradfo/repeat-as-list-figma-plugin

accepted.name: James Bradford
accepted.description: UX Design & UI Development

plugins.name: Percentage Fill
plugins.description:
How to use:

  1. Copy the example frame from the playground file.
  2. Select the layer called "Percentage=(x)%".
  3. Replace "x" with the desired percentage.
  4. Run the plugin with the parent layer(s) selected.


How it works:

  1. Create an auto-layout frame and name it "Percentage=(x)%".
  2. Within that frame, create a few new frames: One should be titled "%" and have fixed width and a filled height. The other should be an auto-layout frame named "Percentage-Content" and have a filled width.
  3. When you run the plugin, it will resize the "Percentage-Content" frame to the size defined in the parent layer.


If you want to center the content, use two "%" layers and place them on either side of the "Percentage-Content" layer.
plugins.tagline: Convert your content to be a percentage fill

plugins.name: MagicFill
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin powered by OpenAI, MagicFill streamlines your design process by populating your layouts with contextually relevant text. It's ideal for data tables and B2B products that require a significant amount of formatted content.


Please note: An OpenAI GPT API key is required to use MagicFill


MagicFill offers a new approach, automating the task of populating designs with meaningful text. This not only saves time but facilitates the creation of more realistic and engaging prototypes.


Key Features:


  • Contextually Relevant Text: MagicFill leverages OpenAI to generate text that complements your design's context, adding an element of realism.
  • Custom Formatting: With MagicFill, you can choose to maintain a consistent format or generate entirely unique content as per your design requirements.
  • Replication of Complex Structures: Input a specific format and MagicFill will generate multiple content variations, preserving the structural format, including line breaks.
  • Real-time Text Population: MagicFill seamlessly populates selected text nodes in your Figma designs in real-time, boosting your design process efficiency.


MagicFill is an efficient tool for Figma users aiming to optimize their design process. It's not just about saving time, it's about adding a new layer of depth to your designs with dynamic and realistic text, contributing to the overall appeal of your prototypes.


For any further information or assistance, please reach out. Your feedback is crucial to our ongoing effort to improve MagicFiller.
plugins.tagline: Fill multiple text layers with realistic AI generated content based on templates or custom content.

plugins.name: Powerful Tools
plugins.description:
This plugin contains a couple of tools that enpower you to fill your design with random dates, IDs, numbers, Chinese names or English names. It also includes a color palette and a mirror that connects an image to a certain frame.

## Use Mirror Tool

This tool is useful to draw an interaction flow that won't mess up your original layer structure.

1. Open the plugin
2. Select a Rectangle layer
3. Type in the name of an exsiting frame
4. It will use the exported png of the frame to fill the rectangle layer.

---

## Use Table Tool

The table generator requires you to have [PingFang SC] & [Inter] fonts installed or it might not work well.

1. Select a Rectangle layer as the placeholder of the output table
2. Open the plugin
3. Choose table
4. Fill in the content
5. Click "Generate"

plugins.name: Auto Resize Height
plugins.description:
Auto Resize Frame

Effortlessly sync your frame heights with the content inside! Auto Resize Frame is a powerful plugin that automatically adjusts the height of selected frames based on the objects within them, streamlining the layout optimization process and improving the overall design experience.


Features

  • Automatically resize the height of selected frames to fit the objects inside (Ignore the Constraints settings of the inner contents!)
  • Keep the top edge of the frame fixed while resizing
  • Display an error message if no frames are selected


How to use

  1. Select the frames you want to resize
  2. Activate the Auto Resize Frame plugin


Save time and maintain consistency in your projects with the user-friendly and efficient Auto Resize Frame plugin!



---


Auto Resize Heightでは、フレームの高さのみを内包コンテンツに合わせて自動でリサイズできるプラグインです。


機能

  • 選択したフレームの高さを、中のオブジェクトに合わせて自動的にリサイズ（中のオブジェクトのConstraintsがScaleの場合でも外側のフレームだけを自動でリサイズ可能）
  • フレームの上端を固定したままリサイズ
  • 選択されているフレームがない場合、エラーメッセージを表示


使い方

  1. リサイズしたいフレームを選択する
  2. Auto Resize Frameプラグインを有効にする
plugins.tagline: Auto-adjust your frame heights to match content in a snap!

plugins.name: Markers
plugins.description:
Create your own markers to help you keep track of you files.

Features

  1. Allows you to search for the markers that you have placed throughout your Figma file.
  2. Allows you to update all the green markers of a category to red to flag changes needed for a screen.
  3. Create a Dashboard to show which page contains what markers.


Instructions

  1. Create a page and call it ‘##Plugin components##’
  2. Create a component called ‘#traffic-status’
  3. The component should have two properties
  • Status, with two properties called red and green (compulsory).
  • Screen, as many as you need. Name needs to be lowercase and have no spacing.
  • Do not add them into a group or the plugin wont be able to find it.

I have created an instruction video to explain how to use it.

https://youtu.be/RLqVMvwIo9U

plugins.name: Fast Slice
plugins.description:
This plug-in is used by designers to quickly mark the size of the frames / groups / component for developers.

  1. Create a slice layer with the same size and the same name in the frame / group / component / instance).
  2. Prevent developers from selecting elements in the frame / instance, getting the wrong icon size and element position.
  3. Add a red background to mark the size of the frame / component / instance.
  4. Hides / shows / selects / deletes all Slice layers in the Frame / Group / Component that you selected.

If you find problems or have any suggestions during use, it is recommended to enter the following link to contact me.

plugins.name: Token Master
plugins.description:
The plugin for Figma automates your color design tokens. With Token Master, you can edit styles in design tokens and quickly create new color modes. Just pick tokens with the same color and edit them at once!


How it works

  1. Install Token Master
  2. Download all styles from your file or add a new color mode. Use keywords [light] and [dark] in your style names to add a new color mode. Example: [light]Style name/ [dark]Style name
  3. To edit a style, click on it. Then, you can use the eyedropper or the color picker in the modal window to select a color
  4. Also, you can copy the whole group of your design tokens and create a new color mode


Styles name examples

We recommend using [light] / [dark] at the beginning of the style name:

[light] Color name 
[dark] Color name


But you can use [light] / [dark] at any place of your style name:

Color name [light]
Color name [dark]
Style / color-name [light]
Style / color-name [dark]
Style [light] / color-name
Style [dark] / color-name


Issues or feature requests

Open an issue on the github

accepted.name: Daniela Muntyan
accepted.description: Product Designer at @figma

plugins.tagline: Automate your design tokens

plugins.name: AI Palette
plugins.description:
• The Figma plugin to generate a color palette would allow users to easily create a set of colors to use in their designs. The plugin would provide various functionalities to generate different types of color palettes based on user requirements.
  • When a user selects the plugin, it would open a dialog box that provides various options for generating the color palette. Users can either choose to create a new color palette or edit an existing one.
  • Once a user selects the option to create a new color palette, they can specify the number of colors they want to include and the color range they want to generate the colors from. The plugin could provide different options to generate colors, such as random, monochromatic, complementary, triadic, analogous, or shades of a specific color.
  • After generating the color palette, the plugin would display the colors in a grid format with the color codes provided for each color. The user can also adjust the color codes or reorder the colors as per their preference.
  • The plugin could also provide additional features such as the ability to save the color palette as a Figma style or export it as a CSS file, making it easier for developers to use the colors in their code.
  • Overall, the Figma plugin to generate a color palette would simplify the process of creating and managing color palettes, saving users valuable time and effort in the design process.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create stunning color palettes with our Figma plugin.

plugins.name: global style to code
plugins.description:
Global Style To Code enables developers to quickly convert global styles (text, paint, and effect) to code. 


All support styles

  • text styles
  • paint styles
  • effect styles


Variable Options

you can convert styles to code in several ways

  • Javascript object style
  • CSS class style (only in paint style)
  • CSS variable style
  • SCSS mixin style
  • SCSS variable style(only in paint style)


if you choose to convert paint style, there are options for color expression

  • RGBA code (default)
  • HEX code (ex. #EEFF00)
  • HSL code (ex. hsl(240, 100%, 50%))


How to use

  1. turn on this plugin in your figma file
  2. check styles that you want to get
  3. check export options
  4. copy and paste on your code!


Got questions?

please contact me :)


If you like this plugin, visit my repository and press star button!

https://github.com/YumYumNyang/yummy-figma-plugin

accepted.name: yumyumnyang
accepted.description: I'm Hyewon(a.k.a YumYumNyang) Creator, Frontend developer.
